Docs.summary: Represents a date in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A CalendarDay object represents a date in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control. You can use this class in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.DayRender> event handler to programmatically access the properties of a date as it is rendered on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control. This allows you to determine the properties of the day (such as whether the date is selectable, selected, today's date, or a weekend date) and programmatically control the appearance or behavior of the day.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of CalendarDay, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarDay.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the properties of a CalendarDay object to determine whether the date being rendered in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.DayRender> event is in the displayed month and do not fall on Saturday or Sunday. These dates are displayed in yellow. Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DayRenderEventArgs.Day%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DayRenderEventArgs> object passed into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.DayRender> event handler is the CalendarDay object.
